subject: Re: [junit] Re: Methods that does not return value
msgSnippet: J. B., You re quite welcome. Sometimes you just have to look at the code and listen to what it s trying to say (to mix my metaphors). It certainly wasn t due
messageBody:
J. B.,

You're quite welcome.

Sometimes you just have to look at the code and listen
to what it's trying to say (to mix my metaphors).

It certainly wasn't due to VAJ knowledge on my part.
The closest (very tongue-in-cheek) I've ever come to
VAJ was a few peeks at the the Smalltalk VA back in my
ParcPlace Systems days where it was a key competitor.

Rick

--- "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbrains@...> wrote:
>
> Wow.
>
> Thanks, Rick, for that exceptionally practical
> insight. Sometimes we can't see the forest for the
> trees. Since I haven't used VAJ since early 2001, I
> would never have made the connection.
>
> Take care.
>
>
> J. B. Rainsberger,
> President, Diaspar Software Services
> Let's write software that people understand.
